action.description: Jake is escorted by two Guards down a jail hall.

dialogue.speaker: PRISONER
dialogue.text: Hey!!

dialogue.speaker: GUARD ONE
dialogue.text: Well, this is it.

action.description: He opens the door and all three of them enter the room.

dialogue.speaker: GUARD TWO
dialogue.text: What wing?

dialogue.speaker: GUARD ONE
dialogue.text: Maximum wing, block 9.

dialogue.speaker: GUARD TWO
dialogue.text: Standard release?

dialogue.speaker: GUARD ONE
dialogue.text: Parole, 3 out of 5, good behaviour.

dialogue.speaker: GUARD TWO
dialogue.text: Gimme a minute...

action.description: He gets Jake's belongings.

dialogue.speaker: GUARD TWO
dialogue.text: One Timex digital watch, broken. One unused prophylactic. One soiled.

action.description: Outside view of Elwood pulling up to the jail entrance.

dialogue.speaker: GUARD TWO
dialogue.text: One black suit jacket. One pair of black suit pants. One hat, black. One pair of sunglasses. Twenty three dollars and seven cents. Sign here.

action.description: Jake signs an X on the form.
Opening Credits start rolling.

location.title: JAKE AND ELWOOD IN THE CAR

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: What's this?

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: This car. This stupid car. Where's the Cadillac? The Caddy? Where's the Caddy?

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: The what?

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: The Cadillac we used to have. The Blues Mobile!

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: I traded it.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: You traded the Blues Mobile for this?

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: No. For a microphone.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: A microphone? Okay I can see that. Well, what the hell is this?

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: This was a bargain. I picked it up at the Mount Prospect City Police auction last spring. It's an old Mount Prospect Police Car. They were practically giving them away.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: Well, thank you pal, the day I get out of prison, my own brother picks me up in a police car.

action.description: Fog horn and warning bell sounds.

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: You don't like it?

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: No, I don't like it.

action.description: Elwood drives over a raising draw bridge.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: Cars got a lot of pick up.

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: It's got a cop motor, a four hundred and forty cubic inch plant, it's got cop tires, cop suspension, cop shocks, it was a model made before catalytic converters so it'll run good on regular gas. Whaddya say? Is it the new Blues Mobile or what?

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: Fix the cigarette lighter.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: What are we doing here?

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: You promised you'd visit the penguin the day you got out.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: Yeah? So, I lied to her.

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: You can't lie to a nun. We gotta go in and visit the penguin.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: No fucking way!

action.description: Jake and Elwood go in and climb the stairs until they reach a door. Just before Elwood knocks on the door, a voice is heard from inside.

dialogue.speaker: NUN
dialogue.text: Who is it?

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: Jake and Elwood.

dialogue.speaker: NUN
dialogue.text: Come in.

action.description: They go in. The door shuts behind them.

dialogue.speaker: NUN
dialogue.text: Hello boys, nice to see you. Please, have a seat.

action.description: Jack and Elwood sit on seats at back of room.

dialogue.speaker: NUN
dialogue.text: No no boys. Come over here in front of me. I want to see your faces.

action.description: They shuffle up a bit closer.

dialogue.speaker: NUN
dialogue.text: The county took a tax assessment of this property last month. They want five thousand dollars.

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: Doesn't the church have to pay that?

dialogue.speaker: NUN
dialogue.text: They would if they were interested in keeping the place, but they aren't. The Arch Bishop wants to sell this building outright to the board of Education.

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: What's gonna happen to you?

dialogue.speaker: NUN
dialogue.text: I'll be sent to the missions.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: Forget it, five grand; no problem, we'll have it for you in the morning. Let's go Elwood.

dialogue.speaker: NUN
dialogue.text: No! No! I will not take your filthy stolen money.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: Well then, I guess you're really up shit creek.

action.description: The nun hits Jake on the hand with a ruler.

dialogue.speaker: NUN
dialogue.text: I beg your pardon what did you say?

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: I offered to help you. You refused to take our money, then I said 'I guess you're really up shit creek'

action.description: She hit's him again.

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: Christ Jake take it easy, man

dialogue.speaker: NUN
dialogue.text: Elwood!

action.description: She starts hitting them both as the language deteriorates.

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: Ah you fat penguin!

action.description: The ruler breaks and the Nun reaches for a sword. Jake and Elwood go tumbling down the stairs.

dialogue.speaker: NUN
dialogue.text: You are such a disappointing pair. I prayed so hard for you. It saddens and hurts me that the two young men whom I raised to believe in the ten commandments have returned to me as two thieves, with filthy mouths and bad attitudes. Get out! And don't come back until you've redeemed yourselves.

action.description: She disappears back into her office and the door mysteriously closes.

dialogue.speaker: CURTIS
dialogue.text: Boys, you gotta learn not to talk to nuns that way. Jake! Elwood!

dialogue.speaker: JAKE & ELWOOD
dialogue.text: Curtis!

dialogue.speaker: CURTIS
dialogue.text: Hey, buy you boys a drink?

dialogue.speaker: CURTIS
dialogue.text: Boys, things are bad. They're gonna sell this place to the board of education and I'll be out on the street. That money's gotta be in the Cook County Assessors office within 11 days.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: They wouldn't turn you out would they?

dialogue.speaker: CURTIS
dialogue.text: Shit. What's one more old nigger to the board of education?

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: Curtis, you and the penguin are the the only family we got. And you're the only one that was ever good to us. Singing Elmore James tunes and blowing the harp for us down here.

dialogue.speaker: CURTIS
dialogue.text: Well, the sister was right. You boys could use a little churching up. Slide on down to the Triple Rock and catch Reverend Cleophis. You boys listen to what he's got to say.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: Curtis, I don't wanna listen to no jive ass preacher talking to me about heaven and hell.

dialogue.speaker: CURTIS
dialogue.text: Jake, you get wise! You get to church!

dialogue.speaker: MC
dialogue.text: And now, this weeks sermon is from our beloved the Reverend Cleophis James.

dialogue.speaker: REVEREND JAMES
dialogue.text: And now people. And now people. When I woke up this morning, I heard a disturbing sound. I said, when I woke up this morning I heard a disturbing sound. What I heard was the jingle-jangle of a thousand lost souls.

dialogue.speaker: REVEREND JAMES
dialogue.text: And I'm talking about the souls of all the men and women, departed from this life. Wait a minute, the Lord says the souls of us here on earth is, secret of divine life, they'll not find.

dialogue.speaker: REVEREND JAMES
dialogue.text: Because it's too late... Too late yeah, too late for them to ever see again, the light they once chose not to follow, don't be lost when the time comes. For the day of the Lord cometh, out of deep in the night. Amen. Amen.

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: Jake, you alright?

action.description: Ray of sunlight shines through the church onto Jake.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: The band...

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: (louder) The band...

dialogue.speaker: REVEREND JAMES
dialogue.text: Do you see the light?

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: (louder) The band!

dialogue.speaker: REVEREND JAMES
dialogue.text: Do you see the light?

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: What light?

dialogue.speaker: REVEREND JAMES
dialogue.text: Have you seen the light?

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: Yes, Yes! Jesus H. god damned bastard Christ, I have seen the light!

action.description: Jake starts dancing with the others.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: The band Elwood. The band!

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: The band?... The band. The band? The band!

dialogue.speaker: REVEREND JAMES
dialogue.text: Praise God.

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: And God bless the United States of America.

location.title: JAKE AND ELWOOD, IN THEIR CAR

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: We'll put the band back together, do a few gigs, we get some bread. Bang! Five thousand bucks.

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: Yeah, well, getting the band back together might not be that easy.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: What're you talking about?

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: They split, they all took straight jobs.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: Yeah so you know where they are. You said you were gonna keep in touch with them

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: I got a coupla leads, a few phone numbers, but I mean, how many of them visited or even wrote you huh?

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: They're not the kinda guys who write letters. You were outside, I was inside, you were s'posed to keep in touch with the band. I kept asking you if we were gonna play again.

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: Well, what was I gonna do? Take away you're only hope? Take away the very thing that kept you going in there? I took the liberty of bullshitting you, okay?

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: You lied to me.

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: It wasn't lies, it was just bullshit.

action.description: Jake and Elwood are in the car, and go through a yellow traffic light. Police lights flash in the rear view mirror.

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: Shit!

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: Rollers.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: No?

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: Shit.

action.description: Elwood pulls over as directed and an officer approaches the car.

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: What? What did I do?

dialogue.speaker: OFFICER DANIEL
dialogue.text: You failed to stop at a red signal.

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: The light was yellow sir.

dialogue.speaker: OFFICER DANIEL
dialogue.text: May I see your license please?

action.description: He takes the license back to the squad car.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: Goddamnit!

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: Man I haven't been pulled over in six months. I bet those cops have got SCMODS.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: SCMODS?

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: State, County, Municipal, Offender, Data, System.

action.description: The two officers return to Jake and Elwood's car.

dialogue.speaker: OFFICER DANIEL
dialogue.text: Elwood, we show your license currently under suspension. Step out of the car please.

action.description: Elwood starts the car and drives off. The officers run back to their car and follow.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: First you trade the Caddilac for a microphone, then you lie to me about the band, now you're gonna put me right back in the joint.

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: They're not gonna catch us. We're on a mission from God.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: Elwood!

dialogue.speaker: OFFICER MOUNT
dialogue.text: (into CB) We are in high speed pursuit northbound on Cortlen Avenue. Black and white 1974 Dodge sedan with Illinios plates. Request assistance.

action.description: Elwood turns into a parking lot. Officers pursue.

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: It would be alright if we could just get back on the expressway.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: This don't look like no expressway to me!

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: Don't yell at me.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: What the hell do you want me to do motorhead?

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: Well, try not to be so negative all the time. Why don't you offer some constructive criticism?

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: You got us into this parking lot pal, so you get us out.

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: You want outta this parking lot? Okay.

dialogue.speaker: SHOP LADY
dialogue.text: Will there be anything else?

dialogue.speaker: CUSTOMER
dialogue.text: Yes, do you have a Miss Piggy?

action.description: Car speeds through toystore and continues on through the rest of the mall. Two Squad cars follows, the original and a backup.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: Hanson Burgers.

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: Yeah. Lots of space in this mall.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: Disco dancing hair cuts.

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: Yeah. Baby clothes.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: This place has got everything.

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: New Oldsmobiles are in early this year.

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: Pier One Imports.

dialogue.speaker: BACKUP OFFICERS
dialogue.text: Oh Shit!

action.description: Backup squad car lands on it's roof and stops.

dialogue.speaker: BACKUP OFFICER
dialogue.text: They broke my watch!

action.description: First squad car crashes too.
Jake and Elwood escape through a shop window to outside.

dialogue.speaker: OFFICER MOUNT
dialogue.text: I'm gonna catch that sucker, if it's the last thing I ever do!

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: Nice place, huh?

action.description: Mystery Women blows up the front doors with a rocket launcher.
Jake and Elwood recover and go inside.

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: Hey Sam... Hey Lloyd, anybody call for me on the phone?

dialogue.speaker: LLOYD
dialogue.text: No, no calls. Some guy left this card. Cop. Said he'd be back.

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: This here's my brother Jake. He just got outta the joint. He's gonna be staying with me for a few weeks.

dialogue.speaker: LLOYD
dialogue.text: Oh OK...

dialogue.speaker: OLD MAN
dialogue.text: Did you get me my cheese whiz, Boy?

action.description: Elwood tosses a can of Cheeze Whiz to the old man.

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: Well, it ain't much, but it's home.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: How often does the train go by?

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: So often you won't even notice it.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: How you gonna get the band back together, Mr Hot-Roder? The cops got your name, you address.

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: No, they don't got my address. I falsified my renewal. Put down 1060 West Addison.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: 1060 West Addison? That's Wrigley Field.

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: I gotta hit the sack.

action.description: Notices Jake asleep in his bed.

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: Hey you sleaze, my bed!

action.description: Elwood sleeps in a chair.

dialogue.speaker: MERCER
dialogue.text: This, gentlemen, is the elegant abode of one Elwood Blues.

dialogue.speaker: OFFICER MOUNT
dialogue.text: Thanks for your help Mr Mercer.

dialogue.speaker: MERCER
dialogue.text: You know, I kinda liked the Wrigley Field bit.

dialogue.speaker: OFFICER MOUNT
dialogue.text: Yeah, real cute.

action.description: They enter the building and go to Elwoods door.

dialogue.speaker: MERCER
dialogue.text: Stand back.

action.description: As Mr. Mercer kicks the door in, the Mystery Woman flicks the switch on her remote control, and the whole building blows up. Jake and Elwood get up and brush themselves off.

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: It's almost nine o'clock. We gotta go to work.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: Mrs. Toronto?

dialogue.speaker: MRS. TORANTINO
dialogue.text: Torantino.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: Ma'am, do you have a Thomas Malone or Louis Marini living here?

dialogue.speaker: MRS. TORANTINO
dialogue.text: Not any more they moved out a long time ago. I don't take in borders, not for a long time.

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: May we come in ma'am?

dialogue.speaker: MRS. TORANTINO
dialogue.text: Please.

action.description: They enter.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: Did they leave a forwarding address? A phone number?

dialogue.speaker: MRS. TORANTINO
dialogue.text: No.

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: Did they live quietly? What were there personal habits?

dialogue.speaker: MRS. TORANTINO
dialogue.text: They were good boys, but they made a lot of racket at night. Are you the police?

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: No ma'am. We're musicians.

action.description: They return to the car and prepare to leave. Mrs Torantino chases them.

dialogue.speaker: MRS. TORANTINO
dialogue.text: Mr. Man! Mr. Man! Mr. Man!

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: Yes, ma'am?

dialogue.speaker: MRS. TORANTINO
dialogue.text: They left this card, maybe it help you?

location.title: THE HOLIDAY INN â€“ THE ARMADA ROOM

action.description: Murph and the Magic Tones are playing to an almost empty room.

dialogue.speaker: MURPH
dialogue.text: Thank you. Your marvellous. Your marvellous. Thank you. I'm Murph and these are the Magic Tones. Steve 'The colonel' Cropper, Donald Duck Dunn, Willie 'Too Big' Hall and Tom 'Bones' Malone. We'll be back with the Magic Tones for the Armada Room's two hour disco swing party after this short break. Til then, don't you go changing.

action.description: They all meet Jake and Elwood at one of the tables.

dialogue.speaker: WILLIE
dialogue.text: So Jake, you're out, you're free, you're rehabilitated, what's next what's happening, whatcha gonna do? You got the money you owe us motherfucker?

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: Look let's just get something straight here. The reason he got locked in the slammer in the first place was for sticking up a gas station to cover you guys.

dialogue.speaker: MURPH
dialogue.text: You're kidding!

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: He pulled that job to pay for the bands room service tab from that Chiwanous gig in Pols city.

dialogue.speaker: WILLIE
dialogue.text: He did?

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: That's right, so I don't wanna hear anymore of this small change shit.

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: We're putting the band back together.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: You were the backbone. The nerve centre of a great rhythm and blues band. You can, make that live, breath and jump again. Murph and the Magic tones? Look at you in those candy ass monkey suits. And I thought I had it bad in Joliet.

dialogue.speaker: TOM
dialogue.text: At least we got a change in clothes sucker, you're wearing the same shit you had on three years ago.

dialogue.speaker: STEVE
dialogue.text: Jake ain't lying though. We had a band powerful enough to turn goat piss into gasoline.

dialogue.speaker: WILLIE
dialogue.text: But we'll never get that fab sound again, not without some more horns. We'll never get Mr. Fabulous.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: Where is he?

dialogue.speaker: MURPH
dialogue.text: Forget it. Mr Fabulous is the top Matre 'd at the Chez Paul. He's pulling down six bills a week.

dialogue.speaker: TOM
dialogue.text: Yeah and Matt Murphy up and got himself married.

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: Where is Matt guitar Murphy?

dialogue.speaker: TOM
dialogue.text: He opened a soul food restaurant with his old lady on Maxwell Street, and he took Blue Lou with him.

dialogue.speaker: WILLIE
dialogue.text: You'll never get Matt and Mr Fabulous outta them high paying gigs.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: Oh yeah? Well me and the Lord. We got an understanding.

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: We're on a mission from God.

dialogue.speaker: MR. FABULOUS
dialogue.text: (into phone) Mainly French cuisine. No sir, Mayor Daly no longer dines here. He's dead sir. Private dining rooms are available.

action.description: He sees Jake walk in with Elwood.

dialogue.speaker: MR. FABULOUS
dialogue.text: Oh no! I thought it was supposed to be five years. Didn't you get five years?

action.description: Back into the phone.

dialogue.speaker: MR. FABULOUS
dialogue.text: Ah no sir, not you. And your name sir? Ritsolo for eight at 11:30. Thank you.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: Mr. Fabulous, how marvellous it is to see you. You're looking younger than ever.

dialogue.speaker: MR. FABULOUS
dialogue.text: Wait, you guys can't come in here.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: Nonsense my dear fellow, my brother and I have come to dine to celebrate my early release from the service of the state.

dialogue.speaker: MR. FABULOUS
dialogue.text: Wait, let's talk outside. Let's have a cup of coffee outside.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: Why heavens no! We seek a full meal and all the compliments of the house. Come Elwood let us adjourn ourselves to the nearest table and overlook this establishments board of fare.

action.description: They enter the dining room as the phone rings.

dialogue.speaker: MR. FABULOUS
dialogue.text: (into phone) Good evening, Chez Paul.

action.description: Now talking to Jake and Elwood.

dialogue.speaker: MR. FABULOUS
dialogue.text: Wait! Hey! (into phone) Ah, sir, would you mind calling back in about five minutes please?

action.description: Jake and Elwood seat themselves at a table. At reception two customers have missed out on their table.

dialogue.speaker: MR. FABULOUS
dialogue.text: (to the couple who missed out on the table) I'm sure we'll have a table for you in just a few minutes.

action.description: Jake and Elwood are ignored until Jake whistles very loudly.

dialogue.speaker: MR. FABULOUS
dialogue.text: (to customers) Excuse me, won't you?

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: Give us a bottle of your finest champagne, five shrimp cocktails, and some bread for my brother.

dialogue.speaker: WAITER
dialogue.text: We have a Don Perignon '71 at $120.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: That'll be fine pal.

dialogue.speaker: MR. FABULOUS
dialogue.text: Come on, seriously you guys, the food here is really expensive. The soup is fucking ten dollars. Come on let's go outside. I'll buy you a cup of coffee.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: We're putting the band back together.

dialogue.speaker: MR. FABULOUS
dialogue.text: Forget it. No way.

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: We're on a mission from god.

action.description: Jake and Elwood's food arrives.

dialogue.speaker: MR. FABULOUS
dialogue.text: Hold it, Hold it. What's this?

dialogue.speaker: CUSTOMER
dialogue.text: Waiter! Sir! Please, waiter!

dialogue.speaker: MR. FABULOUS
dialogue.text: Yes sir. How are your salads?

dialogue.speaker: CUSTOMER
dialogue.text: The salads are fine. It's just that, we'd.. we'd like to move to another table, away from those two gentlemen.

dialogue.speaker: MR. FABULOUS
dialogue.text: Why? Have they been disturbing you?

dialogue.speaker: CUSTOMER
dialogue.text: No. It's just that.. well frankly, they're offensive. Smelling. I mean they smell bad.

dialogue.speaker: MR. FABULOUS
dialogue.text: Excuse me sir, I'll see if I can locate another table for you.

dialogue.speaker: CUSTOMER
dialogue.text: Thank you.

action.description: Jake and Elwoods wine arrives. The wine waiter attempts to serve it.

dialogue.speaker: WAITER
dialogue.text: Wrong glass, sir.

action.description: Jake moves over to the Customers table.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: How much for the little girl? The women? How much for the women?

dialogue.speaker: CUSTOMER
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: Your women. I want to buy your women. The little girl, your daughters. Sell them to me. Sell me your children!

dialogue.speaker: CUSTOMER
dialogue.text: Maitre'd'! Maitre'd!

dialogue.speaker: MR. FABULOUS
dialogue.text: (to Jake) Cut it out. Cut it out. The owners are gonna ask me to call the cops.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: You wouldn't do that to me would ya man?

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: He just got outta Jolliet, he's on parole. You can't call the cops on him man.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: We're putting the band back together.

dialogue.speaker: MR. FABULOUS
dialogue.text: I said no. Absolutely not.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: (to customer) Yo! How much for your wife?

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: (to Mr. Fabulous) We're putting the band back together. We need ya man, we need your horn.

dialogue.speaker: MR. FABULOUS
dialogue.text: I can't, I really can't.

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: We got everybody but Matt guitar Murphy and Blue Lou and we're getting them next.

dialogue.speaker: MR. FABULOUS
dialogue.text: No way.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: If you say no, Elwood and I will come here for breakfast, lunch and dinner every day of the week.

dialogue.speaker: MR. FABULOUS
dialogue.text: Okay, okay, I'll play. You got me.

action.description: Jake and Elwood leaves. Mr. Fabulous sits down at their table.

dialogue.speaker: CUSTOMER
dialogue.text: Sir? Sir. Sir. Sir! Sir?

dialogue.speaker: NAZI LEADER
dialogue.text: White Men! White women! The swastika is calling you. The Jew is using the black as muscle against you. And you are left there helpless. Well, what are you going to do about it, whitey? Just sit there? Of course not. You, are going to join with us. The members of the American, Socialist, White peoples party. An organisation of decent, law abiding white folk. Just like you. I pledge allegiance to Adolf Hitler.

dialogue.speaker: NAZIS
dialogue.text: I pledge allegiance to Adolf Hitler.

dialogue.speaker: NAZI LEADER
dialogue.text: The immortal leader of our race.

dialogue.speaker: NAZIS
dialogue.text: The immortal leader of our race.

dialogue.speaker: NAZI LEADER
dialogue.text: And to the order for which he stands.

dialogue.speaker: NAZIS
dialogue.text: And to the order for which he stands.

dialogue.speaker: NAZI LEADER
dialogue.text: One great cause.

dialogue.speaker: NAZIS
dialogue.text: One great cause.

dialogue.speaker: NAZI LEADER
dialogue.text: Sacred and invincible.

dialogue.speaker: NAZIS
dialogue.text: Sacred and invincible.

action.description: Jake and Elwood are caught in a traffic jam caused by the Nazis.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: (to a patrolling Officer) Hey, what's going on?

dialogue.speaker: OFFICER
dialogue.text: Ah, those bums won there court case so their marching today.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: What bums?

dialogue.speaker: OFFICER
dialogue.text: The fucking Nazi party.

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: Illinios Nazis!

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: I hate Illinios Nazis.

dialogue.speaker: NAZI LEADER
dialogue.text: Heil Hitler!

dialogue.speaker: NAZIS
dialogue.text: Heil Hitler!

action.description: Elwood drives the car up to the bridge and towards the Nazis.

dialogue.speaker: NAZI LEADER
dialogue.text: Tenhuit!

action.description: Elwood speeds up. The Nazis are forced to jump into the water below.

dialogue.speaker: NAZI LEADER
dialogue.text: Perpen Fuhrer?

dialogue.speaker: PERPEN FUHRER
dialogue.text: Yes Sir!

dialogue.speaker: NAZI LEADER
dialogue.text: Perpen Fuhrer get that cars licence plate number. We're gonna kill that son of a bitch.

action.description: Jake and Elwood enter and sit at the counter.

dialogue.speaker: ARETHA
dialogue.text: Help you boys?

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: You got any white bread?

dialogue.speaker: ARETHA
dialogue.text: Yes.

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: I'll have some toasted white bread please.

dialogue.speaker: ARETHA
dialogue.text: You want butter or jam on that toast honey?

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: No ma'am, dry.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: You got any fried chicken?

dialogue.speaker: ARETHA
dialogue.text: Best damn chicken in the state.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: Bring me four fried chickens and a Coke.

dialogue.speaker: ARETHA
dialogue.text: You want chicken wings or chicken legs?

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: Four fried chickens and a Coke.

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: And some dry white toast please.

dialogue.speaker: ARETHA
dialogue.text: You all want anything to drink with that?

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: No ma'am.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: A Coke.

dialogue.speaker: ARETHA
dialogue.text: Be up in a minute.

action.description: She goes back to the kitchen.

dialogue.speaker: ARETHA
dialogue.text: We got two honkies out there dressed like Hacedic Diamond merchants.

dialogue.speaker: MATT
dialogue.text: Say what?

dialogue.speaker: ARETHA
dialogue.text: They look like they're from the CIA or something.

dialogue.speaker: MATT
dialogue.text: What they want to eat?

dialogue.speaker: ARETHA
dialogue.text: The tall one wants white bread, toast, dry with nothing on it.

dialogue.speaker: MATT
dialogue.text: Elwood!

dialogue.speaker: ARETHA
dialogue.text: And the other one wants four whole fried chickens and a Coke.

dialogue.speaker: MATT
dialogue.text: And Jake! Shit, the Blues Brothers!

action.description: Matt goes out into the cafe.

dialogue.speaker: MATT
dialogue.text: Hi Jake.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: Matt. How you doing?

dialogue.speaker: MATT
dialogue.text: Hi Elwood. How ya doing? How was Joliet.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: Oh it was bad. Thursday night they'd serve a wicked pepper steak.

dialogue.speaker: BLUE LOU
dialogue.text: Can't be as bad as the cabbage role at the Terra-Phelevo Penn.

dialogue.speaker: MATT
dialogue.text: Or that oatmeal at the Cook County slammer.

dialogue.speaker: BLUE LOU
dialogue.text: Well they're all pretty bad.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: Matt, me and Elwood, we're putting the band back together. We need you and Blue Lou.

dialogue.speaker: MATT
dialogue.text: Oh man. Don't talk that way round here. My old lady, she'll kill me.

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: Ma'am you gotta understand that this is a lot bigger than any domestic problems you might be experiencing.

dialogue.speaker: ARETHA
dialogue.text: Matt, what the hell is he talking about?

dialogue.speaker: MATT
dialogue.text: Don't get roused sugar.

dialogue.speaker: ARETHA
dialogue.text: Don't you 'Don't get roused sugar' me! Now you not going back on the road no more, and you ain't playing no more two bit sleazy dives. You're living with me now, and you're not gonna go sliding around with you old white hoodlum friends.

dialogue.speaker: MATT
dialogue.text: But babe, this is Jake and Elwood. The Blues Brothers.

dialogue.speaker: ARETHA
dialogue.text: The Blues Brothers! Shit, they still owe you money, fool!

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: Ma'am, would it make you feel any better if you knew that what we asking Matt here to do was a holy thing?

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: You see, we're on a mission from God.

dialogue.speaker: ARETHA
dialogue.text: Don't you blaspheme in here! Don't you blaspheme in here! Now this is my man and my restaurant and you two are gonna just walk right out that door, without ya dry white toast, without ya four fried chickens and without Matt guitar Murphy.

dialogue.speaker: MATT
dialogue.text: Now listen to me. I love you, but I'm the man and your the woman. And I'll make the decisions concerning my life.

dialogue.speaker: ARETHA
dialogue.text: You better think about what you're saying. You better think about the consequences of your actions.

dialogue.speaker: MATT
dialogue.text: Oh shut up woman!

action.description: Matt undoes his apron and drops it on the floor as he leaves.

dialogue.speaker: MATT
dialogue.text: Let's boogie.

action.description: Blue Lou looks at them leaving.

dialogue.speaker: ARETHA
dialogue.text: (to Blue Lou) Well, go ahead dammit.

action.description: He leaves.

dialogue.speaker: ARETHA
dialogue.text: Shit!

location.title: CURL UP AND DYE BEAUTY SALON

action.description: Mystery Woman is reading the instruction booklet for the flame thrower she uses later in the movie.
The band looks around the shop. Elwood finds an electric toaster and pulls a slice of white bread out of his jacket.

dialogue.speaker: RAY
dialogue.text: Pardon me, but we do have a strict policy concerning the handling of the instruments. An employee of Ray's Music Exchange must be present. Now, may I help you?

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: Ray, it's me. Joliet Jake. I once rented some column speakers from you for my band, The Blues Brothers.

dialogue.speaker: MURPH
dialogue.text: Hey Ray it's me Murph of Murph and the Magic tones. Remember me? I bought three Fender amps.

dialogue.speaker: RAY
dialogue.text: Oh we sell a lot of amplifiers.

dialogue.speaker: MURPH
dialogue.text: Not like these they were beautiful. Upholstered with thick red shag.

dialogue.speaker: RAY
dialogue.text: Oh right, right. I remember now. As a matter of fact I buy 'em all back for $350 a piece.

dialogue.speaker: MURPH
dialogue.text: 350? I paid $800 each not six months ago.

dialogue.speaker: RAY
dialogue.text: Oh well you know depreciation man.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: Ray we're here to buy stuff. We need pianos, amps, mikes the works.

action.description: A boy attempts to steal a guitar in the background - Ray pulls out a pistol and fires into the wall above the boys head.

dialogue.speaker: RAY
dialogue.text: Now go on! Git! It breaks my heart, a boy that young goin' bad.

action.description: Murph notices an electric piano.

dialogue.speaker: MURPH
dialogue.text: Tell me a little about this electric piano, Ray.

dialogue.speaker: RAY
dialogue.text: Ah you have a good eye my man. That's the best in the city of Chicago.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: How much?

dialogue.speaker: RAY
dialogue.text: Two thousand bucks and it's yours. You can take it home with you. As a matter of fact I'll through the black keys in for free.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: Two thousand for this chunk o'shit? Come on Ray.

dialogue.speaker: MURPH
dialogue.text: I mean really Ray, it's used, there's no action left in this keyboard.

action.description: Ray comes out from behind the counter and sits at the piano.

dialogue.speaker: RAY
dialogue.text: Excuse me, I don't think there's anything wrong with the action on this piano.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: OK man, we'll take these axes.

dialogue.speaker: RAY
dialogue.text: Naturally, and as usual, I gotta take an IOU. But I Like Smoking Propane

location.title: THEY PULL INTO A ROADSIDE RESTURAUNT

action.description: Everyone gets out of the cars

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: You guys go on inside get yourselves a bite. I've gotta make a phone call.

dialogue.speaker: MR. FABULOUS
dialogue.text: Now Jake, does this phone call concern our first gig?

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: Have I ever lied to you?

action.description: Jake and Elwood walk away, towards a pay phone.

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: What are we gonna do man? We got no gig.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: How much money you got?

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: I got a quarter.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: It's enough for a phone call, come on. Jake and Elwood enter the phone booth, together.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: What are you doing Elwood?

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: You said we were gonna make a call.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: I said I was gonna make a call.

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: Who you gonna call Jake?

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: Remember Maurie Sline?

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: Sline? The booking agent? What about him?

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: Well, he got us some good showcases in the old days. He got us the Morgan Park, he got us the Tic Tock, I got him laid, he owes me.

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: Give it a shot.

action.description: Mystery Woman drives up and attacks phone booth with flame thrower. There's a gas tank next to the booth labeled 'No Smoking Propane'. The explosion launches the phone booth into the air, with Jake and Elwood in it, and then smashes to the ground. Car drives off. Coins are scattered all over the ground from the phone.

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: Hey Jake, there's gotta be at least seven dollars worth of change here.

action.description: Head Nazi is at desk. 2nd Nazi knocks on door.

dialogue.speaker: NAZI LEADER
dialogue.text: Yeah?

dialogue.speaker: 2ND NAZI
dialogue.text: Sir.

dialogue.speaker: NAZI LEADER
dialogue.text: What'd you find out?

dialogue.speaker: 2ND NAZI
dialogue.text: Okay. I called a friend at the Motor Vehicle department. That licence plate is like a rash all over the computer. The car belongs to a known traffic menace.

dialogue.speaker: NAZI LEADER
dialogue.text: What's his name?

dialogue.speaker: 2ND NAZI
dialogue.text: His name is Elwood Blues. He's got a record a mile long. And, he's a catholic.

dialogue.speaker: NAZI LEADER
dialogue.text: Did you get his address?

dialogue.speaker: 2ND NAZI
dialogue.text: Of course. 1060 West Addison.

dialogue.speaker: NAZI LEADER
dialogue.text: Let's go.

action.description: They drive out to the address, 1060 West Addison. It turns out to be Wrigley Field, home of the Cubs Baseball Team.

dialogue.speaker: NAZI LEADER
dialogue.text: (to group) Anybody with that kind of record is gonna make a mistake. I want all party members in the tri state district to monitor the city, county and state police on there CB. Mr. Blues is gonna fuck up. And when he does, he'd better pray the police get to him before we do.

action.description: The band is driving along a dark, quiet road.

dialogue.speaker: MR. FABULOUS
dialogue.text: Alright man, we've been in this car for three hours now. Where the hell is this place?

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: I told you it would take a little while to get there.

dialogue.speaker: MURPH
dialogue.text: What's the name of the place?

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: Ah... the name of the place...

action.description: Jake sees a neon sign ahead with the name of a bar on it.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: Is ah... Bob's Country Bunker. Here we are.

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: Bob's Country Bunker?

action.description: They arrive.

dialogue.speaker: MR. FABULOUS
dialogue.text: Jake, the sign says 'Tonight Only The Good Ole Boys'.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: Blues Brothers. It should read 'Tonight only the Blues Brothers triumphant return'. Must be some kind of mistake. You guys unload the stuff. Elwood, come with me.

action.description: Jake and Elwood head for the bar.

dialogue.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogue.text: Well now what can I get you boys? Are ya thirsty, ya hungry, or you just driving through? Maybe you'd like a beer or something a little harder? Hey, you know we happen to make the states best pepper steak.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: No thank you ma'am. We may be sucking back a few beers a little later on. We'll be here all night. You see, we're the band.

dialogue.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogue.text: You are? Oh, gee, that's nice.

dialogue.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogue.text: (to Bob) Hey Bob!! This is the band!

dialogue.speaker: BOB
dialogue.text: Alright!

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: Er... what kind of music do you usually have here?

dialogue.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogue.text: Oh, we got both kinds. We got Country, and Western.

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: Jake, are you sure this is the place?

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: Yeah, yeah, sure, sure. This is the place.

action.description: Bob walks up to them.

dialogue.speaker: BOB
dialogue.text: Hi. You the Good Ole' Boys?

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: That's us. The rest of the bands out in the parking lot getting our stuff together.

dialogue.speaker: BOB
dialogue.text: Well I'm sure glad to have you boys here. I'm Bob and this here is my place.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: Well its a beautiful place Bob.

action.description: The rest of the band walks in with the gear.

dialogue.speaker: BOB
dialogue.text: I guess you boys wanna get your steel guitars and everything set up on the stage don't ya. Claire get over there and turn those stage lights on and get these boys going up there.

action.description: The lights go on and Lou notices the stage is screened off with chicken wire.

dialogue.speaker: LOU
dialogue.text: Chicken wire?

action.description: Later on, a good size crowd has gathered and rednecks are talking and drinking. Elwood has a song list with requests on it.

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: Man, I don't think we know any of the songs on this list.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: Oh this list doesn't mean anything, they're just requests. We're a regular set.

dialogue.speaker: MURPH
dialogue.text: Gimme some lovin. 1, 2...

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: Good evening ladies and gentlemen we're sure glad to be here in Cocomo tonight. We're the Good Ole' Blues Brothers, boys, band from Chicago. I sure hope you like our show. I'm Elwood, this here's my brother Jake.

action.description: The crowd start yelling at the band and hurling bottles at the stage like crazy. There's a shower of glass smashing against the chicken wire.

dialogue.speaker: BOB
dialogue.text: That ain't no Hank Williams song. He comes out and switches the stage lights off.

dialogue.speaker: MURPH
dialogue.text: I think you hit the lights!

dialogue.speaker: WILLIE
dialogue.text: Maybe they blew a fuse?

dialogue.speaker: LOU
dialogue.text: I don't think so man. Those lights are off on purpose.

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: Okay. We gotta figure out something these people like and fast.

dialogue.speaker: MURPH
dialogue.text: Hey I got it. Remember the theme from Rawhide?

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: The old favourite. Rowdy Yates.

dialogue.speaker: MURPH
dialogue.text: What key?

dialogue.speaker: DONALD
dialogue.text: A. Blues country key.

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: Rawhide in A.

action.description: The crowd is pacified, the lights come back on. They finish the song.

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: Theme from the TV show Rawhide. Thankyou.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: Now we'd like to do a favourite of the horn section. We hope it's one of yours.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: Well folks it's time to call it a night. Do what you feel and keep both feet on the wheel. You don't have to go home but you can't stay here. So till next time...

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: (to the band) Let's get the hell outta here.

action.description: They start packing up, Bob approaches Jake and Elwood.

dialogue.speaker: BOB
dialogue.text: Shit I'm gonna tell you boys that's some of the best goddamn music we've had in the Country Bunker in a long time.

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: Well uh... sorry we couldn't remember the Wreck of the Old 97.

dialogue.speaker: BOB
dialogue.text: Oh, well, hell you guys can learn it next time well ya come back.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: Bob, about our money for tonight.

dialogue.speaker: BOB
dialogue.text: That's right. Uh $200, and you boys drank $300 worth of beer.

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: Uh, well, like, when we first come in the bar lady never charged us for the first round so like we figured you know beer was like complimentary for the band, you know.

dialogue.speaker: BOB
dialogue.text: Uh, hu hu, Uh-Uh.

action.description: Bob shakes his head.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: Well, I'll just go and take up a collection from the boys.

dialogue.speaker: BOB
dialogue.text: Well, I tell ya, I sure would appreciate it.

action.description: Jake and Elwood head out to the cars. The band are talking about the gig.

dialogue.speaker: WILLIE
dialogue.text: I say this trip is no where man. I say we gotta quit.

dialogue.speaker: MURPH
dialogue.text: What? Quit? Well I wish you guys would make up your mind. Otherwise I've gotta call Mr. Ronzinni at the Holiday in and get our old gig back.

dialogue.speaker: STEVE
dialogue.text: Back at the Armada room?

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: (approaches the band) Listen. They want us to pay for the beer we drank, so you guys better split. The next gig is gonna be dynamite, huge, you'll see.

dialogue.speaker: WILLIE
dialogue.text: I say we give the Blues Brothers just one more chance.

dialogue.speaker: DONALD
dialogue.text: Why not? If the shit fits, wear it.

action.description: Getting into he car.

dialogue.speaker: DONALD
dialogue.text: Scoot over goddammit.

action.description: The band leaves.

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: The boys look a little upset. Hey man, don't worry, we got a coupla days. We'll get the penguins tax money. I mean look, we got an appointment to see Mr. Sline tomorrow. Everything's gonna be alright. Let's skate.

action.description: An RV pulls into the parking lot.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: Goddammit.

action.description: Jake and Elwood walk towards the RV as the Good Ole Boys are getting out.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: Excuse me gentlemen are you the Good Ole Boys?

dialogue.speaker: LEADER
dialogue.text: Yeah, that's right, I'm Tucker McElroy, lead singer, driver of the Winnebago. Listen I'd like to talk to you son but were running very late.

action.description: Jake holds up a crunched cigarette packet very quickly as though it were an ID bage of some kind.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: My name is Jacob Stein, the American Federation of Musicians Union local 200. I've been sent here to see if you gentlemen are carrying your permits.

dialogue.speaker: LEADER
dialogue.text: Our what?

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: Your Union cards. May I see your cards please?

dialogue.speaker: LEADER
dialogue.text: S'pose we ain't got no union cards and we go in there and start playing anyway. Now what you gonna do about that? You gonna stop us? Stein? You're gonna look pretty funny trying to eat corn on the cob with no fucking teeth.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: Listen, let me talk to Bob, the owner, see if we can put your band on contract waivers for tonight. I don't want you to move from this spot. Just let me handle this.

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: We'll uh... we'll talk to Bob.

action.description: Jake and Elwood slowly retreat as Bob comes out to the parking lot.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: Get in the car and start her up.

action.description: Elwood goes to the car, Jake goes over to Bob.

dialogue.speaker: BOB
dialogue.text: You know you boys owe me a lot over money for that beer you drank tonight goddammit.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: Bob, we loved playing here tonight. My brother's writing out an American Express travellers cheque to cover the extensive bar tab.

dialogue.speaker: BOB
dialogue.text: Well, I sure would appreciate it.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: I'd better check up, see how he's doing, see I have to sign it too. I usually sit in the car and write it out on the glove compartment lid. Okay?

action.description: Jake walks towards the car and feels his jacket pockets.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: Need a Pencil!

action.description: Jake gets in the car, Elwood starts it and they drive off. The Good Ole boys rush over to Bob.

dialogue.speaker: LEADER
dialogue.text: Were them guys from the union?

dialogue.speaker: BOB
dialogue.text: Union? What the hell union. Those boys skipped outta here owing me a lot of money for beer.

action.description: Notices their costumes.

dialogue.speaker: BOB
dialogue.text: What the hell are you guys all dressed up for?

dialogue.speaker: LEADER
dialogue.text: We're the Good Ole Boys!

dialogue.speaker: BOB
dialogue.text: You're the Good Ole Boys!

action.description: Jake and Elwood are in the blues mobile - Bob and Good Ole Boys in the Winnebago following in the Distance.

dialogue.speaker: LEADER
dialogue.text: Shit.

action.description: Bob fires a shot through their back windshield.

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: Our lady of blessed acceleration don't fail me now.

action.description: Behind a billboard two troopers, Daniel and Mount, have set up a road watch. Jake and Elwood drive by.

dialogue.speaker: TROOPER DANIEL
dialogue.text: I don't believe it. It's that shit-box dodge again.

dialogue.speaker: TROOPER MOUNT
dialogue.text: Bastards are ours now.

action.description: Squad car pulls out with sirens blaring and lights flashing, but crashes into the pursuant Winnebago. The RV does a roll and knocks over a fire hydrant. They all climb out of wreckage. The troopers pull gun on the Good Ole Boys.

dialogue.speaker: TROOPER DANIEL
dialogue.text: Boys, you're in big trouble.

action.description: Jake, Elwood and Mr. Sline in a sauna.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: Maurie, you owe me. We'll play anywhere, anytime for anybody.

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: Put us in the Double Up Lounge or the Morgan Park Theatre, or the Crystal. We always knock them dead in those joints.

dialogue.speaker: MAURIE SLINE
dialogue.text: I don't know boys. I just don't know. Times have changed you know what I mean. What are you guys gonna do? The same act? Wearing the same fracuctus suits. You'll scare people away. Don't you guys ever wear blue jeans or jumpsuits like Wayne Cochran or CC riders?

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: Maurie, you gotta come through for us. We need 5000 bucks fast.

dialogue.speaker: MAURIE
dialogue.text: 5000 bucks? Who do you think you are? The Beatles? Hey, you know the size of hall you gotta work to take in that kinda money, huh?

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: We'll fill any hall in the country.

dialogue.speaker: MAURIE
dialogue.text: You guys familiar with the Palace Hotel Ballroom?

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: Never heard of it.

dialogue.speaker: MAURIE
dialogue.text: Nice place up north. Built in the 40's on Lake Wazzapamani. That seats 5000. You guys fill that place, you can make 5000 bucks easy.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: Book us for tomorrow night.

dialogue.speaker: MAURIE
dialogue.text: Hold it, hold it. Tomorrow night? What are ya talking about? A gig like that, you gotta prepare the proper exploitation.

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: I know about that stuff, I've been exploited all my life.

dialogue.speaker: MAURIE
dialogue.text: Uh Forget it, there's no way with you guys forget about it.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: Say uh, hows Mrs. Sline? I might have some information she'd like to know.

dialogue.speaker: MAURIE
dialogue.text: You blackmailing me Jake?

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: If you want to put it that way. Maurie we need this gig!

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: We're on a mission from God!

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: You get us the hall Maurie and I guarantee we'll pack 'em in from miles around. Whaddya say?

dialogue.speaker: MAURIE
dialogue.text: Okay. I'll get ya the Palace Hotel. I'll print up showbills, I'll make the place look real pretty okay? I don't think you guys are gonna gross dollar one, but if you do, I want a taste of the gig, okay?

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: Okay. Let's go boys.

action.description: Camera angle goes wide to show the whole band were also in the sauna. They get up and leave.
Curtis talks to the kids at the orphanage.

dialogue.speaker: CURTIS
dialogue.text: Listen, you boys heard me talk about Jake and Elwood. Well now they used to live here just like you. And I used to sing to them just like with you. Tonight, Jake and Elwood are going out to sing and play to raise the money to help you children. Your lazy butts are in this too. So get up on that wagon. We're goin' up north to put the word to the streets.

action.description: Jake and Elwood have attached a giant megaphone to the roof of their car and are driving around town to advertise the gig.

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: Tonight only, the fabulous Blues Brothers. Rhythm and Blues review. The Palace Hotel Ballroom. Route 16. Lake Wazzapamani. The fabulous Blues Brothers show band and review.

dialogue.speaker: KIDS
dialogue.text: Check it out, check it out. Tonight only from Chicago the Blues Brothers rhythm and Blues review. One night only, the fabulous...

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: ... Blues Brothers show band, and review. You, on the motorcycle!...You two girls, tell your friends.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: (to Elwood) Free parking.

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: Free parking. 2 dollar cover charge only folks. That's a lot of entertainment.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: (to Elwood) For two dollars.

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: For two dollars.

dialogue.speaker: LITTLE KID
dialogue.text: (speaking to Aretha at the Soul Food CafÃ©) Will you please put this in the window lady cos it's real important?

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: Tonight only. From Chicago. the fabulous Blues Brothers rhythm and blues review for your dancing pleasure...

action.description: Lots of pretty women walking along the lake front.

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: ... and it's ladies night tonight at the Palace Hotel Ballroom.

action.description: In a men's room, written on the wall...

dialogue.speaker: TUCKER MCELROY
dialogue.text: Tonight only the Blues Brothers genuine rhythm and Blues review. Place Hotel Ballroom tonight only.

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: How we doing?

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: Well so far we've covered Lake, McHenry and part of Page County.

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: Good, let's get to the gig.

action.description: The car chokes and splutters.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: What is it?

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: We're outta gas.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: Oh shit.

dialogue.speaker: MURPH
dialogue.text: Oh a classic. What a room. This place is gonna swing tonight.

dialogue.speaker: MR. FABULOUS
dialogue.text: It's a fucking barn. We'll never fill it.

dialogue.speaker: CURTIS
dialogue.text: We've gotta fill this hall tonight. A lot of young children are depending on it.

dialogue.speaker: STEVE
dialogue.text: Young children? Why, whaddya mean?

dialogue.speaker: OWNER
dialogue.text: We're outta gas.

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: Yep, mind if we fill er up?

dialogue.speaker: OWNER
dialogue.text: Nope. I said we're outta gas. Tanker trucks late. Shoulda been here two hours ago. It's always late on Thursdays.

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: Well uh... I'll guess we'll have to wait.

dialogue.speaker: OWNER
dialogue.text: Yeah.

action.description: A sports car with a blond female driver pulls up to the station.

dialogue.speaker: BLONDE
dialogue.text: (to Elwood) Excuse me sir, yes you, could you fill it up with premium please and check under the hood.

action.description: Elwood, stuffing his jacket full of five-finger discount fan belts, looks at the blonde and points to himself as if to say 'Who me?'.

dialogue.speaker: BLONDE
dialogue.text: Yes, you!

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: Sure... you uh want I should uh... wash the dead bugs of the windshield?

dialogue.speaker: BLONDE
dialogue.text: Oh no don't worry. I'm in kind of a hurry.

dialogue.speaker: CURTIS
dialogue.text: Where in the hell are they?

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: So uh... maybe you'd like to uh come by and see the show?

dialogue.speaker: BLONDE
dialogue.text: Oh, I'm awfully sorry, but I do have a prior dinner engagement.

action.description: The tanker pulls in.
Someone hands in a flyer with for the gig.

dialogue.speaker: MR. MERCER
dialogue.text: Thanks Marvin.

action.description: He reads the poster, talks into the phone.

dialogue.speaker: MR. MERCER
dialogue.text: Debbie, get me troopers Daniel and Mount.

action.description: Bob and The Good Ole Boys are in the audience carrying baseball bats.

dialogue.speaker: BOB
dialogue.text: I don't see those Blues Brothers.

dialogue.speaker: TUCKER
dialogue.text: We'll wait.

action.description: Meanwhile, back at the gas station.

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: Okay, you're all set. That'll be... 94 dollars.

dialogue.speaker: BLONDE
dialogue.text: Here's $95. Thank you Elwood.

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: Okay and uh.. that's a dollar change.

dialogue.speaker: BLONDE
dialogue.text: Oh, keep the change.

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: Oh thanks. Uh... so look uh, if you're date don't work out tonight for any reason uh, there's a motel up on the interstate, uh maybe we could say uh meet... around uh midnight?

dialogue.speaker: BLONDE
dialogue.text: I'll think about it Elwood, okay?

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: Yeah. Bye.

action.description: She drives off. Jake looks at his watch and realises the time.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: Son-of-a-bitch.

action.description: He hits Elwood.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: Come on!

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: Owww!

location.title: BACK IN THE PALACE HOTEL BALLROOM

action.description: The audience is becoming impatient.

dialogue.speaker: WILLIE
dialogue.text: I always liked to perform for angry mobs.

dialogue.speaker: CURTIS
dialogue.text: Can't quit now.

dialogue.speaker: MURPH
dialogue.text: What can they be doing?

action.description: Jake and Elwood park the car in a storm drain tunnel near the ballroom.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: Oh. My head hurts. That nitrates a mean wine.

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: You'd better get right pal, we've got a show to do. Then we gotta figure out some way to collect the gate money and get it to the Cook county Assessors office, as soon as they open in the morning.

location.title: BACK AT THE PALACE HOTEL BALLROOM

action.description: The audience is chanting:

dialogue.speaker: AUDIENCE
dialogue.text: We want the show... We want the show... We want the show..

dialogue.speaker: MR. FABULOUS
dialogue.text: Gentlemen, I'm leaving.

dialogue.speaker: WILLIE
dialogue.text: Damm. We were so close.

dialogue.speaker: CURTIS
dialogue.text: Hey, you guys know Minnie the Moocher?

dialogue.speaker: MURPH
dialogue.text: I knew a hooker once named Minnie Mizola?

dialogue.speaker: CURTIS
dialogue.text: No, the song Minnie the Moocher.

dialogue.speaker: STEVE
dialogue.text: Yeah. So what?

dialogue.speaker: CURTIS
dialogue.text: Hit it.

action.description: Throughout the song, Jake and Elwood sneak up to the hotel. They come across the Winnebago. Elwood enters and glues down the accelerator.

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: This is glue. Strong stuff!

action.description: The song ends. Police officers arrive in the audience.

dialogue.speaker: TROOPER DANIEL
dialogue.text: Okay. Let's take them.

dialogue.speaker: MR. MERCER
dialogue.text: Now wait a minute. We haven't even heard these boys sing. Alright?

dialogue.speaker: TROOPER DANIEL
dialogue.text: Alright. They're not going no place.

dialogue.speaker: MR. MERCER
dialogue.text: Alright. Cover all exits. Let's go. Come on hurry up. Move it.

action.description: Meanwhile, Jake and Elwood get into the Ballroom through the ladies room amongst lot's of screaming.

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: Excuse us.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: Good evening ladies.

dialogue.speaker: MR. MERCER
dialogue.text: (to Troopers) Who wants an orange whip? Orange whip?

dialogue.speaker: MR. MERCER
dialogue.text: (to a nearby Officer) Three orange whips.

action.description: Jake and Elwood make an Entrance.
Curtis spots Jake and Elwood and gets the all clear to start the intro.

dialogue.speaker: CURTIS
dialogue.text: And now ladies and gentlemen, it is the distinct pleasure of the management to present to you, the evening's star attraction. Here they are back after their exclusive three year tour of Europe, Scandinavia and the sub continent. Won't you welcome from Calumet City Illinios, the show band of Joliet Jake and Elwood Blues... The Blues Brothers.

action.description: Jake and Elwood enter the stage during the brass section of the intro music, and and Jake does a cartwheel and lands besides Elwood right on cue with the last beat of the song... the audience is deathly quiet.
Bands starts playing 'Everybody Needs Somebody to Love'.

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: We're so glad to see so many of you lovely people here tonight. We would especially like to welcome all the representatives of Illinios' law enforcement community who have chosen to join us here at the Place Hotel Ballroom at this time. We certainly hope you all enjoy the show and remember people that no matter who you are and what you do to live, thrive and survive, there's still some things that make us all the same. You, me, them everybody, everybody.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: Thank you. That was for Wilson Picket. This is dedicated to the late great magic sound.

action.description: Half way through the 'Sweet Home Chicago', Jake and Elwood go off back stage. They are met there by a record agent.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: It looks like the Mafia is out there.

dialogue.speaker: AGENT
dialogue.text: You guys are great. I've gotta record you.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: Bullshit!

dialogue.speaker: AGENT
dialogue.text: Bullshit? I don't bullshit. I'm president of Clarion records the largest recording company on the eastern sea board.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: So what?

dialogue.speaker: AGENT
dialogue.text: Here's 10,000 dollars. An advance on your first recording session.

action.description: He hands over the cash.

dialogue.speaker: AGENT
dialogue.text: Is it a deal?

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: Yeah, sure it's a deal.

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: Yeah, yeah, sure.. . sure it's a deal. Ah listen all these cops out here, they're sorta waiting for us. We gotta get outta here without nobody seeing us. Do you know a back door outta this place?

dialogue.speaker: AGENT
dialogue.text: Sure. I used to be head bouncer here back in the 70's. There's an electrical service duct right behind your drummers riser.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: Listen, do us a favour. Take 1400 dollars and give it to Rays Music Exchange in Calumed city. Give the rest to the band.

dialogue.speaker: AGENT
dialogue.text: You got it.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: Thanks. Bye.

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: Bye.

dialogue.speaker: AGENT
dialogue.text: Bye.

action.description: Jake and Elwood crawl on to the stage and get into the service duct. Jake get's Willies attention.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: Me and Elwood are gonna make a break for it. You and the band keep playing.

dialogue.speaker: TROOPER DANIEL
dialogue.text: Something's wrong.

dialogue.speaker: MR. MERCER
dialogue.text: Where's Jake?

dialogue.speaker: TUCKER
dialogue.text: (to Good Ole Boys) Where'd those Blues Brothers go?

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: I sure hope this thing leads some place.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: Elwood. We're gone man. The 'Mystery Woman' loosens off a round of machine gun fire. They hit the ground.

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: Who is that girl?

dialogue.speaker: WOMAN
dialogue.text: Well Jake. You like just fine down there, slithering in the mud like vermin.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: (to Elwood) No problem.

dialogue.speaker: WOMAN
dialogue.text: You're not gonna get away from me this time.

action.description: She fires again... still missing them.
Mr. Mercer hears the gunshots.

dialogue.speaker: MR. MERCER
dialogue.text: (to officers) Check that out. Let's go. Come on.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: (to Woman) It's good to see you sweetheart.

dialogue.speaker: WOMAN
dialogue.text: You contemptible pig. I remained celebate for you. I stood at the back of a cathedral, waiting in celibacy for you, with 300 friends and relatives in attendance. My uncle hired the best Romanian caterer in the state. To obtain the seven limousines for the wedding party my father used up his last favours with Mad Pete Trollo. So for me, for my mother, my grandmother, my father, my uncle and for the common good, I must now kill you and your brother.

action.description: Jake gets up and slowly walks towards her.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: (falling to his knees before her) Oh please don't kill us. Please, please don't kill us. You know I love ya baby, I wouldn't leave ya. It wasn't my fault.

dialogue.speaker: WOMAN
dialogue.text: You miserable slug. You think you can talk you're way out of this? You betrayed me.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: No, I didn't. Honest. I ran outta gas. I had a flat tire. I didn't have enough money for cab fare. My tux didn't come back from the cleaners. An old friend came in from outta town. Someone stole my car. There was an earthquake, a terrible flood, locust's. It wasn't my fault!! I swear to God!!

dialogue.speaker: WOMAN
dialogue.text: Oh Jake, Jake, honey.

action.description: Jake embraces her in a passionate kiss, then drops her in the mud.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: (to Elwood) Let's go.

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: (to the Woman) Take it easy.

action.description: They run down the passage to the car. She follows in the distance.

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: It's a 106 miles to Chicago. We got a full tank of gas, half a pack of cigarettes, it's dark and we're wearing sunglasses.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: Hit it!

action.description: The Woman runs out of the duct and fires at the moving car. The policemen above hear the shots and also start shooting at the car.
Jake and Elwood are in front in their car. About 50 or so squad cars and the Good Ole Boys Winnebago is following.

dialogue.speaker: BOB
dialogue.text: Shit man! Can't this damm thing go any faster than this?

dialogue.speaker: TUCKER
dialogue.text: Ah, Bob, I think I got a little problem.

dialogue.speaker: BOB
dialogue.text: Goddamn boy!

action.description: They accelerate past all cars including Jake and Elwoods.

dialogue.speaker: TUCKER
dialogue.text: Shit!

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Argh!!!

action.description: The van drives off the highway, through a shed and into the water.

dialogue.speaker: TUCKER
dialogue.text: (to Bob) Don't you say a fucking word.

location.title: VIEW OF BLONDE WAITING AT MOTEL

action.description: The sun starts to rise.

dialogue.speaker: RADIOER
dialogue.text: All units we have a signal ten seven niner, officers are in pursuit a black and white, 1974 dodge sedan southbound on four-seven. Responds to signal ten seven niner. Occupants of vehicle on Joliet Jake Blues, one Elwood Blues. Consider them extremely dangerous.

action.description: In Nazi Head Quarters, the head Nazi hears police radio broadcast.

dialogue.speaker: NAZI LEADER
dialogue.text: Perpen-Fuhrer!

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: Hey, Jake, Jake, I gotta pull over.

dialogue.speaker: TROOPER MOUNT
dialogue.text: South bound on state highway 47.

action.description: Elwood drives down an embankment, squad cars follow and all crash.
Head Squad car recovers and steers out of control, goes flying up the embankment which acts as a ramp...the police car flies through the air and lands in the side of a truck.

dialogue.speaker: MR. MERCER
dialogue.text: Hi. Wanna hand me the mike? Thanks a lot.

dialogue.speaker: MR. MERCER
dialogue.text: (into the mic) Hi, this is car, ah...what number are we?

dialogue.speaker: OFFICER MOUNT
dialogue.text: Five, Five.

dialogue.speaker: MR. MERCER
dialogue.text: (into the mike) Car fifty five. Ah, we're in a truck!

location.title: BACK AT THE CHICAGO POLICE STATION

dialogue.speaker: RADIOER
dialogue.text: Signal ten seven niner still engaged. Vehicle travelling south bound. Approaching Chicago city limits. Commander advisers will contact Chicago precincts for a local intercept. Maintain pursuit.

action.description: Hundreds of officers merge on the city.

dialogue.speaker: RADIOER
dialogue.text: Use of unnecessary violence in the apprehension of the Blues Brothers has been approved.

location.title: JAKE AND ELWOOD MAKE IT TO CHICAGO

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: Well this is definitely Lower Wacker drive. If my estimations are correct, we should be very close to the honourable Richard J. Daly plaza.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: That's were they got that Picasso.

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: Yep.

action.description: They drive on, being chased by Chicago squad cars. Elwood swerves to miss a car, the squad cars don't and all crash into one another.

dialogue.speaker: OFFICER
dialogue.text: Son-of-a-bitch.

action.description: Starts firing, other officers follow suit.
Jake and Elwood escape.
Two Nazi cars hide in an alley way. Jake and Elwood drive past.

dialogue.speaker: NAZI LEADER
dialogue.text: There they are.

action.description: The Nazi cars pursues Jake and Elwood.
A loud clunk is heard in Jake and Elwood's car.

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: Oh no!

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: What the fuck was that?

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: The motor. Thrown a rod.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: Is that serious?

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: Yep.

action.description: They drive up a bridge through the smoke coming from their motor.

dialogue.speaker: NAZI LEADER
dialogue.text: Faster!

action.description: At the last minute they see the end of an unfinished bridge. Elwood stops the car and then it backflips over the chasing Nazi car.

dialogue.speaker: NAZI
dialogue.text: Holy shit!

action.description: The Nazi car continues to accelerate and launches off the bridge.

dialogue.speaker: NAZI
dialogue.text: I've always loved you.

action.description: They crash into the street making a big hole. Jake and Elwood's car jumps the hole, the pursuing Nazi car falls into it.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: (points to a building) There it is.

action.description: Elwood parks the car just outside the door. They get out and the car falls to bits. Elwood stares at in disbelief.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: (hitting Elwood) Come on!

action.description: They enter the building, close the doors and pile furniture in front of them. They then run up to an information counter.

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: (to an officer at the information desk) Sir. Where's the Office of the Assessor of Cook County?

dialogue.speaker: OFFICER
dialogue.text: Down the hall, turn right, take the elevator to 1102.

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: Thank you sir.

action.description: Jake and Elwood race off. Outside thousands of people are trying to get in. Jake and Elwood enter the elevator. A squad of people eventually get into the building and race up to the information desk.

dialogue.speaker: SQUAD LEADER
dialogue.text: Excuse me, did you see two guys come in here, black suits black hats one carrying a briefcase?

dialogue.speaker: OFFICER
dialogue.text: Yeah, I just sent them down there.

dialogue.speaker: SQUAD LEADER
dialogue.text: Thank you.

action.description: The squad races towards the elevator and then up the stairs.
Jake and Elwood make it to the right floor.

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: Hold the door.

action.description: Jake steps in front of the door. Elwood destroys the elevators controls.

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: Let's go.

action.description: They make their way towards the officer. Stacking furniture in front of each door. They arrive at the office to a sign 'Back in five minutes'. They wait until someone in the office approaches them.

dialogue.speaker: ASSESSOR
dialogue.text: May I help you?

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: This is where they pay the taxes, right?

dialogue.speaker: ASSESSOR
dialogue.text: Right.

dialogue.speaker: ELWOOD
dialogue.text: This money is for the years assessment on the St. Helen of the Blessed Shroud orphanage in Calumed city, Illinios.

dialogue.speaker: JAKE
dialogue.text: 5000 bucks, it's all there pal.

action.description: The squad approaches the right floor but the door is blocked.

dialogue.speaker: OFFICER
dialogue.text: Stand back... fire!

action.description: They open fire on the door.

dialogue.speaker: ASSESSOR
dialogue.text: And here is your receipt.

action.description: The squad catches up with Jake and Elwood and cuff them.
The whole band is on a stage in the jail.
